core_innovations.innovation: Two-antenna signal cancellation for micro-gesture detection
core_innovations.description: Uses signals from one antenna to cancel signals from another, creating extremely sensitive detection of mm-level finger movements
Eliminates need for user-specific or location-specific training through consistent waveform shapes
First system to detect extremely fine finger gestures using conventional WiFi signals
Novel algorithm that prevents over-stretching in Dynamic Time Warping for gesture classification

sensitivity_analysis.antenna_distance_effect: Sensitivity increases up to 10cm, then plateaus

baseline_comparisons.limitation: Cannot detect subtle finger movements due to noise levels
Requires dedicated radar chipset, LOS only
baseline_comparisons.mudra_advantage: Uses existing WiFi signals, supports NLOS
Training-free operation across users and environments

platform.hardware: NI PXIe-1082 chassis with PXIe-8133 controller
platform.fpga: Virtex-5 based FPGA with NI-5791 FlexRIO adapters

novelty.justification: First system to achieve fine-grained finger gesture recognition using WiFi signals

technical_rigor.justification: Comprehensive system design with detailed signal processing pipeline and extensive evaluation

experimental_validation.justification: Thorough evaluation across multiple environments, users, and scenarios

practical_impact.justification: Training-free operation and use of existing WiFi infrastructure make it practically deployable

reproducibility.justification: Detailed implementation description but requires specialized SDR hardware

citation_potential.research_impact: Pioneering work in WiFi-based micro-gesture recognition

methodological_contributions: Signal cancellation technique for micro-motion detection
